metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7395 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: SkPath.cpp in Skia, as used in Google Chrome before 53.0.2785.89 on Windows and OS X and before 53.0.2785.92 on Linux, does not properly validate the return values of ChopMonoAtY calls, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (uninitialized memory access and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted graphics data.

notes.Note: chrisccoulson> Fixed in the Skia bundled with Firefox since at least 50.0. Thunderbird has an older version of Skia in which this code doesn't exist

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu1').
firefox package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
